black.description: Use as Black where black colour is needed. This is a core colour and cannot be modified.

darkest.description: Darkest grey colour. This is a core colour and cannot be modified.

darker.description: Darker grey. This is a core colour and cannot be modified.

dark.description: Dark grey. This is a core colour and cannot be modified.

light.description: Light grey. This is a core colour and cannot be modified.

lighter.description: Lighter grey. This is a core colour and cannot be modified.

lightest.description: Lightest grey. This is a core colour and cannot be modified.

white.description: White. This is a core colour and cannot be modified.

default.description: Caution colour for Status and Alerts. This colour is reserved only for Status/Alerts and cannot be modified.

darker.description: General information colour for Status and Alerts. This colour is reserved only for Status/Alerts and cannot be modified.

lighter.description: Caution colour for Status and Alerts. This colour is reserved only for Status/Alerts and cannot be modified.

lightest.description: Caution colour for Status and Alerts. This colour is reserved only for Status/Alerts and cannot be modified.

default.description: General information colour for Status and Alerts. This colour is reserved only for Status/Alerts and cannot be modified.

darker.description: General information colour for Status and Alerts. This colour is reserved only for Status/Alerts and cannot be modified.

lighter.description: General information colour for Status and Alerts. This colour is reserved only for Status/Alerts and cannot be modified.

lightest.description: General information colour for Status and Alerts. This colour is reserved only for Status/Alerts and cannot be modified.

default.description: Error colour for Status and warnings / Error alerts. This colour is Core and cannot be modified.

darker.description: Error colour for Status and Warning / Error alerts. This colour is reserved only for Status/Alerts and cannot be modified.

lighter.description: Error colour for Status and warnings / Error alerts. This colour is reserved only for Status/Alerts and cannot be modified.

lightest.description: Error colour for Status and Warning / Error alerts. This colour is reserved only for Status/Alerts and cannot be modified.

default.description: Success colour for Status and Alerts. This colour is reserved only for Status/Alerts and cannot be modified.

darker.description: Success colour for Status and Alerts. This colour is reserved only for Status/Alerts and cannot be modified.

lighter.description: Success colour for Status and Alerts. This colour is reserved only for Status/Alerts and cannot be modified.

lightest.description: Success colour for Status and Alerts

light.description: Light coloured underline colour used for text links in Alerts messaging. This colour is reserved only for Status/Alerts and cannot be modified.

dark.description: Dark coloured underline colour used for text links in Alerts messaging. This colour is reserved only for Status/Alerts and cannot be modified.

green.description: Used as Values colour in code snippet blocks for QGDS. This is a core colour and cannot be modified.

light-blue.description: Used as Elements colour in code snippet blocks for QGDS.  This is a core colour and cannot be modified.

violet.description: Used as Properties colour in code snippet blocks for QGDS. This is a core colour and cannot be modified.

muted.description: Used as Comments colour in code snippet blocks for QGDS. This is a core colour and cannot be modified.

background.description: Used as the Custom background colour when using the advanced banner in a contained layout. There is only 1 variable that is automatically applied based on the colour of the header.

background-dark.description: Used as the Custom background colour when using the advanced banner in a contained layout. There is only 1 variable that is automatically applied based on the colour of the header.

light.description: Primary background colour when using light palette

light-shade.description: Darker shade of the light background. Used as fills for elements such as accordions and call outs on top of light backgrounds.

alt.description: Primary background colour when using light palette

alt-shade.description: Darker shade of the Alt background. Used to slightly shade elements such as accordions and call outs on top of the Alt background.

light.description: Decorative border colour used on light backgrounds

alt.description: Border colour for form borders on all light backgrounds. Must meet contrast ratio of 3:1 across all light backgrounds

primary.description: Colour of primary actions / buttons used on a light themed container

primary-hover.description: Hover colour for primary actions / buttons

secondary.description: Colour for secondary actions. Button border for secondary action buttons. Icon colour for icon actions.

on-action.description: Colour for text/icons on a primary action button

default.description: Default underline colour for underlining links to assist with accessibility and readability.

design-accent.description: Brand accent colour, used for key highlights and content dividers. Purely decorative and do not require an accessibility check.

default.description: Focus colour should be as consistent as possible and ideally not the same as any action colour. Focus colours must meet a contrast ratio of 3:1.
Default underline colour for underlining links to assist with accessibility and readability.

visited.description: Visited link underline colour for underlining links to assist with accessibility and readability.

visited-hover.description: Hover colour for visited link underline.

default.description: Text colours are indicated by the text icon. All text contrast must meet WCAG 2.0 Level AA conformance which means a contrast ration of 4.5:1

lighter.description: Lighter text used for inactive states, captions, and secondary information.

heading.description: Heading colours within text. These should be shades of your brand colour and if posisble different from primary action and link colours so the user does not interpret them as clickable.

site-title.description: Colour for title of site in header component

default.description: Primary background colour when using Dark palette

default-shade.description: Darker shade of the Primary Dark background. Used as fills for elements such as accordions and call outs on top of dark backgrounds.

alt.description: Secondary background colour when using Dark palette

alt-shade.description: Darker shade of the Secondary Dark background. Used as fills for elements such as accordions and call outs on top of dark backgrounds.

default.description: Decorative border colour used on dark primary backgrounds

alt.description: Border colour for form borders on all dark backgrounds. Must meet contrast ratio of 3:1 across all dark backgrounds

primary.description: Colour of primary actions / buttons used on a dark themed container

primary-hover.description: Hover colour for primary actions / buttons

secondary.description: Colour for secondary actions. Button border for secondary action buttons. Icon colour for icon actions.

default.description: Colour for hyperlink text when using dark palette

visited.description: Colour for visited links when using dark palettes

on-action.description: Colour for text/icons on a primary action button

design-accent.description: Brand accent colour, used for key highlights and content dividers. Purely decorative and do not require an accessibility check.

default.description: Focus colour should be as consistent as possible and ideally not the same as any action colour. Focus colours must meet a contrast ratio of 3:1.
Default underline colour for underlining links to assist with accessibility and readability.

visited.description: Visited link underline colour for underlining links to assist with accessibility and readability.

visited-hover.description: Hover colour for visited link underline.

default.description: Heading colours within text. These should be shades of your brand colour and if possible different from primary action and link colours so the user does not interpret them as clickable.

lighter.description: Lighter text used for inactive states, captions, and secondary information.

heading.description: Heading colours within text. These should be shades of your brand colour and if possible different from primary action and link colours so the user does not interpret them as clickable.

site-title.description: Colour for title of site in header component
